didoss@... wrote:

> In general, I like it.
> 
> It seems to start off well, but I might rephrase it near the end, in 
> order to stay away from sounding like it is a "bad day".
> 
> To someone's point, possibly provide the link to google - in case they 
> truly don't know what it means to "Google it" [OT - when will that make 
> it to the dictionary].  Additionally (to the "bad day" effect), you 
> might want to rephrase the RTFF, into something a little more tame, but 
> still to the point that we all have bad days.
> 
> Finally, I would question the use of "SPECIFIC question" at the 
> end,...maybe just stick with  "If you still haven't found what you are 
> looking for, please feel free to send your question/query to 
> junit@yahoogroups.com."  Very often, we have 
> lively/interesting/entertaining discussions that aren't really formed 
> around a "SPECIFIC question".  We might end up restricting things too much.

Thank you for these suggestions. I'll try to incorporate them soon.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
